ai-sn46:5.1.4_0: How is the awakening factors defined?”
ai-sn46:5.1.5_0: “Mendicant, they’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.
ai-sn46:5.1.6_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,
ai-sn46:5.1.7_0: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

ai-sn46:5.1.11_0: They’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.”
ai-sn46:6.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa in the deer part at the Añjana Wood.
ai-sn46:6.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Kuṇḍaliya went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn46:6.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn46:6.1.4_0: “Master Gotama, I like to hang around the monasteries and visit the assemblies.
ai-sn46:6.1.5_0: When I’ve finished breakfast, it’s my habit to
ai-sn46:6.1.6_0: wander from monastery to monastery, from park to park.
ai-sn46:6.1.7_0: There I see some ascetics and brahmins speaking for the sake of winning debates and finding fault.
ai-sn46:6.1.8_0: But what benefit does Master Gotama live for?”
ai-sn46:6.1.9_0: “The benefit the Realized One lives for, Kuṇḍaliya, is the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”
ai-sn46:6.2.1_0: “But what things must be developed and cultivated in order to fulfill knowledge and freedom?”
ai-sn46:6.2.3_0: “But what things must be developed and cultivated in order to fulfill the seven awakening factors?”
ai-sn46:6.2.4_0: “The four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, fulfill the seven awakening factors.”
ai-sn46:6.2.5_0: “But what things must be developed and cultivated in order to fulfill the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?”
ai-sn46:6.2.7_0: “But what things must be developed and cultivated in order to fulfill three things?”
ai-sn46:6.3.1_0: And Kuṇḍaliya, how is sense restraint developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the three kinds of good conduct?
ai-sn46:6.3.2_0: A mendicant sees an agreeable sight with their eye. They don’t desire it or enjoy it, and they don’t give rise to greed.
ai-sn46:6.3.3_0: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and well freed.
ai-sn46:6.3.4_0: But if they see a disagreeable sight they’re not dismayed; their mind isn’t hardened, dejected, or full of ill will.
ai-sn46:6.3.5_0: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and well freed.
ai-sn46:6.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant hears an agreeable sound with the ear ...
ai-sn46:6.4.2_0: When I smelled an odor with my nose ...
ai-sn46:6.4.3_0: tastes a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-sn46:6.4.4_0: feels an agreeable touch with the body ...
ai-sn46:6.4.5_0: When they know a thought with their mind, they don’t desire it or enjoy it.
ai-sn46:6.4.6_0: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and well freed.

ai-sn46:6.5.5_0: feels an agreeable touch with the body ...

ai-sn46:6.5.7_0: That’s how sense restraint is developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the three kinds of good conduct.
ai-sn46:6.6.1_0: And how are the three kinds of good conduct developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?
ai-sn46:6.6.2_0: A mendicant gives up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develops good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-sn46:6.6.3_0: That’s how the three kinds of good conduct are developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn46:6.7.1_0: And how are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the seven awakening factors?
ai-sn46:6.7.2_0: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn46:6.7.4_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn46:6.7.5_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn46:6.7.6_0: That’s how the four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the seven awakening factors.
ai-sn46:6.8.1_0: And how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to fulfill knowledge and freedom?
ai-sn46:6.8.2_0: A mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,
ai-sn46:6.8.3_0: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
ai-sn46:6.8.4_0: That’s how the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to fulfill knowledge and freedom.”
ai-sn46:6.9.1_0: When he said this, the wanderer Kuṇḍaliya said to the Buddha,
ai-sn46:6.9.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-sn46:6.9.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

ai-sn46:6.9.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

ai-sn46:7.1.2_0: In the same way, a mendicant who develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.

ai-sn46:7.2.4_0: That’s how a mendicant who develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
ai-sn46:8.1.1_0: At one time the venerables Upavāna and Sāriputta were staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-sn46:8.1.2_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to Venerable Upavāna.

ai-sn46:8.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.

ai-sn46:14.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn46:14.1.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying in the Pipphali cave.
ai-sn46:14.1.3_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to Venerable Mahākassapa.
ai-sn46:14.1.3_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-sn46:14.1.3_2: He sat down on the seat spread out, and said to Mahākassapa,
ai-sn46:14.2.1_0: “Can you bear up, Kassapa? Can you carry on?
ai-sn46:14.2.1_1: Do painful feelings decrease and not increase?
ai-sn46:14.2.1_2: Is it known that they are decreasing and not increasing?”
ai-sn46:14.2.2_0: “No, reverend Sir, I cannot bear up, nor can I carry on,
ai-sn46:14.2.2_1: painful feelings greatly increase for me and do not decrease,
ai-sn46:14.2.2_2: and it is known that they increase and do not decrease.”
ai-sn46:14.3.1_0: “Kassapa, I’ve rightly explained these seven awakening factors. When developed and cultivated, they lead to direct knowledge, to awakening, and to extinguishment.
ai-sn46:14.3.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by seven?
ai-sn46:14.3.3_0: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.
ai-sn46:14.3.3_1: The awakening factor of equanimity that is equanimity, when developed and cultivated, leads to direct knowledge, to awakening, and to extinguishment.
ai-sn46:14.3.4_0: These are the seven awakening factors that I’ve rightly explained. When developed and cultivated, they lead to direct knowledge, to awakening, and to extinguishment.”
ai-sn46:14.3.5_0: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are awakening factors!

ai-sn46:52.8.1_0: “Mendicants, when wanderers who follow other paths say this, you should say to them:
ai-sn46:52.8.2_0: ‘But reverends, is there a way in which the five hindrances become ten and the seven awakening factors become fourteen?’
ai-sn46:52.8.3_0: Questioned like this, the wanderers who follow other paths would be stumped, and, in addition, would get frustrated.
ai-sn46:52.8.5_0: Because they’re out of their dispensation.
ai-sn46:52.8.6_0: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could provide a satisfying answer to this riddle except for the Realized One or his disciple or someone who has heard it from them.
ai-sn46:52.9.1_0: And what is the way in which the five hindrances become ten?
ai-sn46:52.9.2_0: Sensual desire for what is internal is a hindrance; and sensual desire for what is external is also a hindrance.
ai-sn46:52.9.3_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of sensual desire’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.9.4_0: Ill will for what is internal is a hindrance; and ill will for what is external is also a hindrance.
ai-sn46:52.9.5_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of ill will’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.9.6_0: Dullness is a hindrance; and drowsiness is also a hindrance.
ai-sn46:52.9.7_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of dullness and drowsiness’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.9.8_0: Restlessness is a hindrance; and remorse is also a hindrance.
ai-sn46:52.9.9_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of restlessness and remorse’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.9.10_0: Doubt about internal things is a hindrance; and doubt about external things is also a hindrance.
ai-sn46:52.9.11_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of doubt’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.9.12_0: This is the way in which the five hindrances become ten.
ai-sn46:52.10.1_0: And what is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen?
ai-sn46:52.10.2_0: The awakening factor of mindfulness is also the awakening factor of mindfulness; and the awakening factor of mindfulness is also a Mindfulness.
ai-sn46:52.10.3_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of mindfulness’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.11.1_0: Investigating, exploring, and inquiring into internal things with wisdom is the awakening factor of investigation of principles; and investigating, exploring, and inquiring into external things with wisdom is also the awakening factor of investigation of principles.
ai-sn46:52.11.2_0: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of investigation of principles’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.12.1_0: Physical energy is the awakening factor of energy; and mental energy is the awakening factor of energy.
ai-sn46:52.12.2_0: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of energy’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.13.1_0: Rapture while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of rapture; and rapture without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of rapture.
ai-sn46:52.13.2_0: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of rapture’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.14.1_0: Physical tranquility is the awakening factor of tranquility; and mental tranquility is also the awakening factor of tranquility.
ai-sn46:52.14.2_0: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of tranquility’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.15.1_0: Immersion while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of immersion; and immersion without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of immersion.
ai-sn46:52.15.2_0: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of immersion’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.16.1_0: Equanimity for internal things is the awakening factor of equanimity; and equanimity for external things is also the awakening factor of equanimity.
ai-sn46:52.16.2_0: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of equanimity’ becomes twofold.
ai-sn46:52.16.3_0: This is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen.”
